en.label: Sword Coast Calendar (D&D 5e)
en.description: The Calendar of Harptos used along the Sword Coast and throughout the Forgotten Realms, in the years following the Spellplague and the Second Sundering.

months.name: Hammer
months.description: Deepwinter - The coldest month, when folk stay close to hearth and home.

months.name: Alturiak
months.description: The Claw of Winter - Still cold, but days grow longer as spring approaches.

months.name: Ches
months.description: The Claw of the Sunsets - Early spring, when flowers begin to bloom.

months.name: Tarsakh
months.description: The Claw of the Storms - Spring storms and new growth throughout the realms.

months.name: Mirtul
months.description: The Melting - Late spring, when the last snows melt in the mountains.

months.name: Kythorn
months.description: The Time of Flowers - Early summer, when wildflowers carpet the land.

months.name: Flamerule
months.description: Summertide - The hottest month, when the sun blazes overhead.

months.name: Eleasis
months.description: Highsun - Late summer, the peak of the growing season.

months.name: Eleint
months.description: The Fading - Early autumn, when leaves begin to change color.

months.name: Marpenoth
months.description: Leaffall - Mid-autumn, when harvests are gathered.

months.name: Uktar
months.description: The Rotting - Late autumn, when leaves fall and decay.

months.name: Nightal
months.description: The Drawing Down - Early winter, when folk prepare for the cold months.

weekdays.name: Sulday
weekdays.description: First day of the tenday, often reserved for worship and rest

weekdays.name: Molday
weekdays.description: Second day, traditionally for beginning new endeavors

weekdays.name: Tuenday
weekdays.description: Third day, a common market day in many settlements

weekdays.name: Godsday
weekdays.description: Fourth day, often dedicated to religious observances

weekdays.name: Shieldsday
weekdays.description: Fifth day, traditionally for military training and defense

weekdays.name: Swordsday
weekdays.description: Sixth day, often for combat practice and competitions

weekdays.name: Spellsday
weekdays.description: Seventh day, favored by wizards and magical study

weekdays.name: Kingsday
weekdays.description: Eighth day, often for civic duties and legal matters

weekdays.name: Lordsday
weekdays.description: Ninth day, traditionally for noble affairs and formal events

weekdays.name: Tensday
weekdays.description: Tenth and final day of the tenday, often for rest and reflection

intercalary.name: Midwinter
intercalary.description: A festival day between Hammer and Alturiak, celebrating the heart of winter

intercalary.name: Greengrass
intercalary.description: A spring festival between Tarsakh and Mirtul, welcoming the growing season

intercalary.name: Midsummer
intercalary.description: The most important festival, between Flamerule and Eleasis

intercalary.name: Shieldmeet
intercalary.description: Occurs every four years after Midsummer, a grand festival and political gathering

intercalary.name: Highharvestide
intercalary.description: An autumn festival between Marpenoth and Uktar, celebrating the harvest
